meanings.definition: An estate in land, especially one held in fee simple or for life.
meanings.sent1: My grandparents left me a freehold property in their will.
meanings.sent2: The farmer owned the freehold of the vast land for generations.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my cat thinks she has a freehold on the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was a freehold, unchanging and everlasting.
meanings.sent5: The freehold of the ancient castle was a symbol of power and heritage.

meanings.definition: The tenure by which such an estate is held.
meanings.sent1: The legal document clearly stated the terms of the freehold.
meanings.sent2: His family's freehold was passed down through many generations.
meanings.sent3: The freehold of the haunted house was rumored to come with ghostly roommates.
meanings.sent4: In her hands, the key represented the freehold to a world of secrets.
meanings.sent5: The freehold of the company was a source of stability and pride for the employees.
